workflow.name: Cross-platform brand monitoring & analysis with AnySite API and GPT
workflow.description:
![Screenshot 20251031 at 11.45.25.png](fileId:3153)
## Overview

This n8n workflow automates **brand monitoring across social media platforms** (Reddit, LinkedIn, X, and Instagram) using the **AnySite API**.  
It searches posts mentioning your defined keywords, stores results in n8n Data Tables, analyzes engagement and sentiment, and generates a detailed **AI-powered social media report** automatically sent to your email.

---

## Key Features

- **Multi-Platform Monitoring:** Reddit, LinkedIn, X (Twitter), and Instagram  
- **Automated Post Collection:** Searches for new posts containing tracked keywords  
- **Data Persistence:** Saves all posts and comments in structured Data Tables  
- **AI-Powered Reporting:** Uses GPT (OpenAI API) to summarize and analyze trends, engagement, and risks  
- **Automated Email Delivery:** Sends comprehensive daily/weekly reports via Gmail  
- **Comment Extraction:** Collects and formats post comments for deeper sentiment analysis  
- **Scheduling Support:** Can be executed manually or automatically (e.g., every night)

---

## How It Works

### Triggers

The workflow runs:
- Automatically (via **Schedule Trigger**) — e.g., once daily  
- Manually (via **Manual Trigger**) — for testing or on-demand analysis

### Data Collection Process

1. **Keyword Loading:**  
   Reads all keywords from the Data Table **“Brand Monitoring Words”**

2. **Social Media Search:**  
   For each keyword, the workflow calls the **AnySite API** endpoints:  
   - `api/reddit/search/posts`  
   - `api/linkedin/search/posts`  
   - `api/twitter/search/posts` (X)  
   - `api/instagram/search/posts`

3. **Deduplication:**  
   Before saving, checks if a post already exists in the **“Brand Monitoring Posts”** table.

4. **Data Storage:**  
   Inserts new posts into the Data Table with fields like `type`, `title`, `url`, `vote_count`, `comment_count`, etc.

5. **Comments Enrichment:**  
   For Reddit and LinkedIn, retrieves and formats comments into JSON strings, then updates the record.

6. **AI Analysis & Report Generation:**  
   The **AI Agent** (OpenAI GPT model) aggregates posts, analyzes sentiment, engagement, risks, and generates a structured **HTML email report**.

7. **Email Sending:**  
   Sends the final report via Gmail using your connected account.

---

## Setup Instructions

### Requirements

- Self-hosted or cloud **n8n instance**  
- **AnySite API key** – [https://AnySite.io](https://AnySite.io)  
- **OpenAI API key** (GPT-4o or later)  
- Connected **Gmail** account (for report delivery)

---

### Installation Steps

1. **Import the workflow**  
   Import the provided file:  
   `Social Media Monitoring.json`

2. **Configure credentials**
   - **AnySite API:** Add `access-token` header with your API key  
   - **OpenAI:** Add your OpenAI API key in the “OpenAI Chat Model” node  
   - **Gmail:** Connect your Gmail account (OAuth2) in the “Send a message in Gmail” node

3. **Create required Data Tables**

---

### 1️⃣ Brand Monitoring Words

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `word` | string | Keyword or brand name to monitor |

> Each row represents a single keyword to be tracked.

---

### 2️⃣ Brand Monitoring Posts

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `type` | string | Platform type (e.g., reddit, linkedin, x, instagram) |
| `title` | string | Post title or headline |
| `url` | string | Direct link to post |
| `created_at` | string | Post creation date/time |
| `subreddit_id` | string | (Reddit only) subreddit ID |
| `subreddit_alias` | string | (Reddit only) subreddit alias |
| `subreddit_url` | string | (Reddit only) subreddit URL |
| `subreddit_description` | string | (Reddit only) subreddit description |
| `comment_count` | number | Number of comments |
| `vote_count` | number | Votes, likes, or reactions count |
| `subreddit_member_count` | number | (Reddit only) member count |
| `post_id` | string | Unique post identifier |
| `text` | string | Post body text |
| `comments` | string | Serialized comments (JSON string) |
| `word` | string | Matched keyword that triggered capture |

---

## AI Reporting Logic

- Collects all posts gathered during the run  
- Aggregates by keyword and platform  
- Evaluates sentiment, engagement, and risk signals  
- Summarizes findings with an executive summary and key metrics  
- Sends the **Social Media Intelligence Report** to your configured email

---

## Customization Options

- **Schedule:** Adjust the trigger frequency (daily, hourly, etc.)  
- **Keywords:** Add or remove keywords in the **Brand Monitoring Words** table  
- **Report Depth:** Modify system prompts in the “AI Agent” node to customize tone and analysis focus  
- **Email Recipient:** Change the target email address in the “Send a message in Gmail” node

---

## Troubleshooting

| Issue | Solution |
|-------|-----------|
| No posts found | Check AnySite API key and keyword relevance |
| Duplicate posts | Verify Data Table deduplication setup |
| Report not sent | Confirm Gmail OAuth2 connection |
| AI Agent error | Ensure OpenAI API key and model selection are correct |

---

## Best Practices

- Use **specific brand or product names** in keywords for better precision  
- Run the workflow daily to maintain fresh insights  
- Periodically review and clean Data Tables  
- Adjust AI prompt parameters to refine analytical tone  
- Review AI-generated reports to ensure data quality

---

## Author Notes

Created for **automated cross-platform brand reputation monitoring**, enabling real-time insights into how your brand is discussed online.

options.systemMessage:
= You are a social media intelligence analyst inside an n8n workflow. Your job: given post_ids and/or pre-fetched posts plus user-defined keywords, you must retrieve records for each post_id from the internal database if needed, normalize and analyze them, generate a concise yet exhaustive report, and send that report by email using the provided email tool. Do not browse the web. Do not invent data. Tools You will be provided one or more tools. Prefer these canonical names if available; otherwise use whichever exact email tool is exposed to you in this runtime: • send_email • fetch_posts_by_ids Returns an array of Post objects. If a tool is unavailable, skip it and proceed with what you have; record any missing post_ids in missing_ids. Input (user message JSON) { "post_ids": ["..."], // required if "posts" is absent "keywords": ["rocket","anysite"], // required (one or more) "time_range": {"from":"ISO","to":"ISO"}, // optional "language": "en", // report language; default "en" "time_zone": "Europe/Amsterdam", // default "Europe/Amsterdam" "email_to": "user@example.com", // required to send the email "context": {"brand":"...","campaign":"...","notes":"..."}, // optional "posts": [ { ... } ] // optional: full post objects already provided } Data handling • If posts present → use directly. • If only post_ids → call fetch_posts_by_ids. Record any misses in missing_ids. • Analyze only provided/returned data. No external calls. Expected post fields (may vary) type, title, text, url, created_at (Unix or ISO), comment_count, vote_count/like_count/repost_count, platform-specific (subreddit_*, comments (array or JSON string), post_id, word, etc.). Normalization 1. Convert created_at to ISO8601 localized to time_zone (default Europe/Amsterdam). 2. Parse comments if JSON string → array. 3. Deduplicate by post_id or url. 4. Infer platform from type. 5. Detect post language; if different from report language, include a brief 1–2 line translation. 6. Map each post to matched keyword(s): from word and actual matches in title/text. 7. Disambiguate keyword senses with confidence: • rocket → space/launch, brands (e.g., Rocket Mortgage), games/memes, autos (e.g., BRABUS Rocket), food (arugula), fashion/other. • anysite → product/brand vs generic phrase “any site”. Per-post analytics For every post compute: • engagement_proxy: sum of available counters (comment_count + vote_count/like_count/repost_count). If parsed comments array exists, you may add its length. Missing counters → 0. • recency_hours: hours since created_at to now. • keyword_match_strength: "strong" (title/exact), "medium" (body), "weak" (comments/tags), "meta" (only via word). • sentiment: positive / neutral / negative + 1-sentence rationale. • entities: notable brands/people/products/places if inferable. • risks: toxicity, misinformation/rumors, controversy, compliance issues. • drivers: short notes on what likely drove engagement (e.g., striking media, controversy, timing, celebrity/brand mention). • confidence: high / medium / low based on data completeness, clarity, and sense disambiguation. Aggregations (deeper detail) • Totals: count of posts; split by platform. • By keyword: count and share (% of total), plus average engagement_proxy and sentiment mix per keyword. • Senses distribution per keyword (counts, shares, example posts). • Platform breakdown: per platform totals, median and 75th-percentile engagement (approximate via sorted ranks), top topics. • Trend narrative over time_range: textual description of spikes/dips (hourly/daily as appropriate). • Topic clusters/themes: derive 3–7 themes using simple keyword co-occurrence (e.g., {“space/test/launch”}, {“auto/brabus/edition”}, {“security/telemetry/ads”}); list 1–2 representative posts per theme. • Influential accounts/authors: where author info is available, rank by contribution to engagement. • Risks & watchouts: consolidated list across posts with brief why-it-matters. • Recommended actions: prioritized, actionable next steps (max per limits.max_actions), with impact/effort tags. • Confidence & data quality: summarize coverage, missing counters, inferred senses. Report composition (rich) • Subject: Social Media Report • {YYYY-MM-DD} • {keywords} • {posts_count} • HTML body (inline CSS; no external assets). Include these sections in order: 1. Header • Title, date, time window, time zone, optional context (brand/campaign). 2. Executive summary (5–9 bullets) • Key shifts, top themes, standout posts, immediate risks, recommended next actions (1–3). 3. Key metrics (KPI grid + table) • Totals, by-platform split, by-keyword split (counts, shares, avg engagement, sentiment mix). • Use simple CSS bars (e.g.,
) to visualize shares. 4. Keyword senses • Table of senses per keyword with counts, examples, and confidence notes. 5. Trends & themes • Short narrative of volume/engagement over time. • 3–7 themes/clusters with 1–2 representative links each. 6. Top posts • Up to limits.max_top_posts overall and up to limits.top_posts_per_platform per platform. • For each: platform, title/summary, link, localized timestamp, engagement_proxy, sentiment, matched keyword(s) & sense, 1–2 brief quotes/comments, drivers, risks (if any). 7. Platform insights • Per-platform highlights: what content resonated, posting times, tone/style patterns. 8. Risks & watchouts • Bullet list (≤ limits.max_risks) with brief mitigation ideas. 9. Recommended actions • Prioritized list with Impact / Effort tags (e.g., High/Low), owner suggestion if inferable from context. 10. Methodology & limitations • Data source (workflow), missing counters treated as 0, heuristic senses, no external sources, confidence statement. • Plain text: same flow as HTML in clean Markdown/ASCII. HTML tips (email-safe) • Inline CSS only; no external fonts/images/JS. • Use simple tables and
bars for shares. • Keep quotes ≤2 lines; truncate long text with ellipsis. CSV attachments (if supported by tool) Attach up to four CSVs: 1. summary.csv: keyword,count,share,avg_engagement,positive,neutral,negative 2. posts.csv: platform,created_at,url,engagement_proxy,sentiment,keyword,sense,match_strength 3. top_comments.csv: platform,post_url,author,created_at,excerpt 4. entities.csv: entity,type,frequency,example_post_url Quality & constraints • No fabricated data. Missing counters → 0 (note in methodology). • Absolute timestamps with time_zone. • Keep paragraphs tight and scannable. • Language = language (default "en"). Error handling • If email_to missing → do not send; respond with status "error" and reason. • If email tool fails → return "error" with the tool’s message. Final action — you MUST send the email 1. Build subject, html, text per spec (depth per depth: • standard: sections 1–3, 6, 10 • extended (default): all sections except 7 (optional) • max: include all sections with fuller detail within limits) 2. Call the email tool with: • to = email_to • subject, html, text • attachments if supported 3. After sending, reply with a single compact JSON acknowledgment (do not echo the full HTML): Return exactly one JSON object: { "status": "sent" | "error", "to": "string", "subject": "string", "totals": { "posts": 0, "platforms": {"reddit":0,"x":0,"linkedin":0,"instagram":0}, "by_keyword": [{"keyword":"...","count":0,"share":0.0}], "time_window": {"from":"ISO","to":"ISO","time_zone":"Europe/Amsterdam"} }, "missing_ids": ["..."], "notes": ["..."] // e.g., "Engagement counters missing on some platforms; treated as 0." } Pre-send checklist • Subject has date, keywords, post count. • HTML uses inline CSS only. • Totals match analyzed posts. • Time zone consistent. • email_to present and non-empty. ⸻ Minimal HTML skeleton you can adapt

Social Media Report

Date: {{DATE}} • Window: {{FROM}} — {{TO}} ({{TZ}})

{{#if CONTEXT}}

Context: {{CONTEXT}}

{{/if}}

Executive summary

    {{BULLETS}}

Key metrics

{{KPI_ROWS}}
MetricValue

By keyword

{{KEYWORD_ROWS}}

Keyword senses

{{SENSE_TABLE}}

Trends & themes

{{TREND_NARRATIVE}}

    {{THEME_BULLETS}}

Top posts

{{TOP_POST_CARDS}}

Platform insights

{{PLATFORM_SECTIONS}}

Risks & watchouts

    {{RISK_BULLETS}}

Recommended actions

    {{ACTION_ITEMS}}

Methodology & limitations

Data analyzed exactly as provided by the workflow (no external sources). Missing counters treated as 0. Keyword senses and themes inferred heuristically. Confidence: {{CONFIDENCE}}.

Remember: analyze only provided data, send the email yourself via the tool, then return the compact JSON acknowledgment.

parameters.content:
## Social Media Monitoring Workflow with AnySite.io

## Who's it for
Marketing teams, brand managers, PR specialists, and customer success teams who need real-time brand monitoring across multiple social media platforms for sentiment analysis, crisis management, and competitive intelligence.

## How it works
1. Schedule trigger runs daily/hourly to monitor brand mentions
2. Searches across Reddit, LinkedIn, Instagram, and X/Twitter simultaneously
3. Checks database to avoid duplicate processing
4. Fetches full post details and comments for new mentions
5. AI Agent analyzes sentiment and context using GPT-4
6. Sends email alerts for important mentions via Gmail
7. Stores all data in PostgreSQL for historical analysis

## Requirements
- AnySite.io API account with access tokens
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4 recommended)
- PostgreSQL database for post tracking
- Gmail account for notifications
- n8n self-hosted or cloud instance

## How to set up
1. **Update AnySite credentials**:
   - Add your access-token to all AnySite HTTP nodes
2. **Configure search keywords**:
   - Update "Get word's list" node with your brand terms
3. **Set up PostgreSQL**:
   - Create posts table with required schema
4. **Configure Gmail**:
   - Connect Gmail OAuth for notifications
5. **Adjust schedule**:
   - Set monitoring frequency in Schedule Trigger
6. **Test with manual trigger first**

## How to customize
- **Add platforms**: Create new search nodes with AnySite API endpoints
- **Modify analysis**: Update AI Agent prompts for specific insights
- **Change alerts**: Replace Gmail with Slack, Discord, or webhook
- **Add filters**: Insert IF nodes to filter by sentiment/reach
- **Historical reports**: Add scheduled aggregation nodes
- **Export data**: Connect to BI tools or data warehouses

## Built with AnySite.io
This workflow uses AnySite.io APIs for reliable, scalable social media data extraction.

## 🚀 Built with AnySite.io

**Created by:** Andrew Kulikov
**Company:** AnySite.io
**Workflow Version:** 1.0
**Last Updated:** October 2025

**Learn more:** [anysite.io](https://anysite.io)
**API Docs:** [docs.anysite.io](https://docs.anysite.io)
**Contact:** andrew@anysite.io

💚 **How to Customize Your Monitoring:**

**Add platforms:**
- Use AnySite.io APIs for TikTok, YouTube, Facebook
- Copy existing search node structure

**Modify alerts:**
- Replace Gmail with Slack, Discord, MS Teams
- Add webhooks to your CRM/ticketing system

**Change analysis:**
- Edit AI Agent system prompt for specific insights
- Add sentiment scores, urgency levels, action items

**Schedule frequency:**
- Real-time: Every 15 minutes
- Standard: Hourly
- Daily digest: Once per day

**Filter results:**
- Add IF nodes to filter by engagement/sentiment
- Create priority tiers for different keywords

## 1. Triggers & Keywords Setup
[Learn about Schedule Triggers](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/core-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.scheduletrigger/)

Workflow can be triggered by:
• Schedule Trigger - Automated monitoring (hourly/daily)
• Manual Trigger - On-demand execution for testing

**Get word's list** node:
- Define brand keywords to monitor
- Supports multiple search terms
- Each term searches across all platforms

💡 Pro tip: Use brand name variations, product names, and common misspellings

## 🧪 Testing Your Workflow

**Initial Test:**
1. Use Manual Trigger first (not Schedule)
2. Add 1-2 test keywords in "Get word's list"
3. Execute and verify each stage completes
4. Check database for inserted records
5. Verify email notification arrives

**Validate each stage:**
✅ All 4 platform searches return results
✅ Database checks work (duplicates prevented)
✅ Post details fetched correctly
✅ AI analysis runs without errors
✅ Email formatted properly

**Common issues:**
- Missing access-token → Check all HTTP nodes
- Database errors → Verify schema and connection
- No email → Check Gmail OAuth and recipient

## 2. Cross-Platform Search Phase
[AnySite.io Platform APIs](https://anysite.io/docs)

Parallel searches across:
• **Reddit** - Posts and discussions
• **LinkedIn** - Professional posts
• **Instagram** - Visual content
• **X/Twitter** - Real-time conversations

Each platform search:
- Uses AnySite.io optimized APIs
- Returns top 2 most relevant posts
- Includes metadata (author, timestamp, engagement)
- Sorts by relevance for best matches

⚡ All searches run in parallel for speed

## 3. Database Deduplication
[PostgreSQL Integration](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.postgres/)

For each found post:
• Checks if post_id exists in database
• Prevents duplicate processing
• Saves API calls and AI analysis costs

**If post doesn't exist:**
→ Proceeds to Insert and Analysis

**If post exists:**
→ Skips to next post

This ensures:
- No duplicate alerts
- Efficient resource usage
- Clean historical data

## 4. Platform-Specific Data Extraction
[AnySite.io APIs](https://anysite.io)

For new posts, fetches complete data:

**Reddit:**
- Post details (title, author, score, timestamp)
- All comments and replies

**LinkedIn:**
- Post content and engagement metrics
- Comments and reactions

**Updates database with:**
- Full post text
- Comment threads (as formatted strings)
- Metadata for analysis

This rich context enables accurate AI sentiment analysis.

## ⚠️ SETUP REQUIRED (3/3)

**OpenAI Configuration:**
- Add OpenAI API credentials
- Recommended: GPT-4o for best results
- Configure in "OpenAI Chat Model" node

**Gmail Setup:**
- Connect Gmail OAuth credentials
- Configure recipient in "Send a message in Gmail" tool
- Customize email template in AI Agent prompt

**Test checklist:**
✅ AnySite tokens work
✅ Database connection active
✅ AI Agent can query posts
✅ Gmail sends notifications

## 5. Intelligent Analysis & Notifications
[AI Agent Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/root-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.agent/)

**AI Agent with Tools:**
1. **Get Posts Info** - Retrieves all new posts from database
2. **GPT-4 Analysis** - Analyzes sentiment, urgency, context
3. **Send Gmail** - Sends alerts for important mentions

The AI Agent autonomously:
• Fetches unprocessed posts
• Analyzes sentiment (positive/negative/neutral)
• Identifies urgent issues or opportunities
• Prioritizes alerts by importance
• Sends formatted email summaries

🎯 Customizable prompts for industry-specific insights

## 📊 Monitoring Best Practices

**Keyword Strategy:**
• Brand name + common variations
• Product names and SKUs
• Competitor mentions
• Industry hashtags
• Crisis-related terms

**Alert Prioritization:**
🔴 High Priority:
- Negative sentiment + high engagement
- Crisis keywords detected
- Competitor comparisons

🟡 Medium Priority:
- Questions from users
- Feature requests
- Neutral discussions

🟢 Low Priority:
- Positive mentions
- General discussions

**Performance Tips:**
- Monitor 5-10 core keywords
- Adjust search count per platform
- Archive old data periodically
- Set up separate workflows for high-volume terms

## ⚠️ SETUP REQUIRED (1/3)

**AnySite.io API Configuration**

All HTTP Request nodes need your access token:
1. Find all nodes starting with "AnySite..."
2. Open each node settings
3. In Headers → access-token
4. Replace with your actual token

📝 Nodes to update:
- AnySite Search Reddit Posts
- AnySite Search LinkedIn Posts
- AnySite Search Instagram Posts
- AnySite Search X Posts
- AnySite Get Reddit Post
- AnySite Get Reddit Post Comment
- AnySite Get LinkedIn Post Comments

[Get your API token at anysite.io](https://anysite.io/api-keys)

## ⚠️ SETUP REQUIRED (2/3)

**Data Tables Setup**

#### 📋 Brand Monitoring Words
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `word` | string | Keyword or brand name to track |

#### 📊 Brand Monitoring Posts
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `type` | string | Platform type (reddit, linkedin, x, instagram) |
| `title` | string | Post title or caption |
| `url` | string | Post URL |
| `created_at` | string | Creation date/time |
| `subreddit_id` | string | (Reddit only) Subreddit ID |
| `subreddit_alias` | string | (Reddit only) Subreddit alias |
| `subreddit_url` | string | (Reddit only) Subreddit URL |
| `subreddit_description` | string | (Reddit only) Subreddit description |
| `comment_count` | number | Number of comments |
| `vote_count` | number | Votes, likes, or reactions count |
| `subreddit_member_count` | number | (Reddit only) Subreddit member count |
| `post_id` | string | Unique post identifier |
| `text` | string | Post content text |
| `comments` | string | Serialized comments (JSON string) |
| `word` | string | Keyword that triggered capture |


Update connection in nodes:
- If post does not exist (checks)
- Insert post nodes
- Update post nodes
- Get post_id for all new posts

user.name: Andrey
user.bio: CEO of AnySite.io | Agent-first web scraping APIs for LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter & Reddit. Try our n8n nodes for reliable, self-healing data extraction. DM for custom integrations.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
